description: Students journey toward greater understanding of the human body through an integrated study of the
structure of the body (anatomy) and how organs such as the brain, heart, and kidney perform their
remarkable functions (physiology). The course is designed primarily for students intending careers
in the health sciences. Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week.
Prerequisite: Biology 125, or Chemistry/Biology 125-127.  Offered annually.
Counts towards exercise science major and neuroscience concentration.
